ygData.subject: Coding style notes
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve just finished fetching/reviewing a lot of the code created last week -- looks like a lot of good stuff! However, a few general style/practice issues were

I've just finished fetching/reviewing a lot of the code created last
week -- looks like a lot of good stuff!

However, a few general style/practice issues were notable:

(1) It's "HerItrix", not "HerAtrix". FYI, "heritrix" is an archaic word for 
"heiress" or "inheritess". 

(2) Please eliminate compiler warnings -- also highlighted in Eclipse
with yellow -- before code check-ins. Usually this is just a matter of
choosing the "organize imports" option to clen up the imports section
of a class file. 

(3) Remember that we seek to follow the Java coding conventions at:

    http://java.sun.com/docs/codeconv/html/CodeConvTOC.doc.html

In particular, the block following an "if" statement -- even it's
merely a single statement or quick return -- should always be
delimited by { brackets }. 

(4) If your lines have grown long or your indentation/spacing seems amiss,
you can highlight a region and use the Eclipse "source->format" option,
which typically does the right thing.

- Gordon
